intro: Polypodium villosum, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy fronds that give it a distinctive appearance. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The fronds are typically evergreen, with a leathery texture and a serrated margin. It is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks in moist, forested areas.
